required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Monitoring the Response of Port Wine Stain Birthmarks to Laser Therapy With Wide-field Functional Imaging Technologies
clinical_study.official_title: Monitoring the Response of Port Wine Stain Birthmarks to Laser Therapy With Wide-field

collaborator.agency: Beckman Laser Institute University of California Irvine

brief_summary.textblock: The researcher develop non-invasive imaging modalities for assessment of port wine stain during laser therapy treatment of Port Wine Stain. The imaging modalities will be used to guide immediate retreatment of regions of persistent perfusion during the procedure.

detailed_description.textblock: The researcher can use imaging system operates by projecting low-power near-infrared structured light patterns on to the tissue of interest in a non-contact, reflection geometry and then capturing the reflectance with a camera.The system can image the depth-resolved optical properties of in-vivo tissues, allowing rapid, non-invasive visualization of sub-surface structures of Port Wine Stain.

primary_outcome.measure: Image-guided surgery remove Port Wine Stain
primary_outcome.description: Image-guided surgery remove Port Wine Stain

arm_group.description: Image-guided surgery remove Port Wine Stain

intervention.description: Image-guided surgery remove Port Wine Stain

study_pop.textblock: Study population will be selected from an outpatient population with Port Wine Stain birthmark at Beckman Laser Institute and Medical Clinic, University of California, Irvine. Patients with Port Wine Stain birthmark will be candidates for participation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All minors, birth to 18 years of age or older with Port Wine Stain birthmark
- Ability to understand and carry out subject instructions
- Sign photograph release form
Exclusion Criteria:
- Inability to understand and/or carry out instructions
- Pregnant women
- Do not sign photograph release form

overall_official.affiliation: Beckman Laser Institute University of California Irvine

responsible_party.investigator_full_name: Beckman Laser Institute and Medical Center
responsible_party.investigator_title: Bernard Choi, Ph.D., Assistant Professor Biomedical Engineering
